maml:description.maml:para: Returns the current admin report setting
Will return the current admin report privacy setting (conceal or show names).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-M365AdminReportSettings
Name Value ---- ----- displayConcealedNames True @odata.context https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/$metadata#admin/reportSettings/$entity

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returned 'displayConcealedNames = True' meaning names will be shown in any admin center reports. The default value for displayConcealedNames is False. Use Set-M365AdminReportSettings to change this value.

maml:description.maml:para: List all groups and group types from Azure AD including source of authority.

List out all groups in Azure AD. Easily filter by security groups, O365 (unified) groups, dynamic groups, distribution groups or list all. Outputs group name, object ID, MailEnabled, Mail, and source (OnPrem or Cloud) and dynamic membership rule.
This will output all grouptypes.
List only distribution groups
List only dynamic membership groups
List only security enabled groups
List only Office 365 groups
This will output all grouptypes.
List only distribution groups
List only dynamic membership groups
List only security enabled groups
List only Office 365 groups

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export a list of all groups to a CSV file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365GroupReport | Export-Excel -path C:\reports\M365MasterReport.xlsx -worksheetname M365GroupReport -tablename GroupReport -Autosize

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export a list of all groups into an excel workbook as a table on an excel worksheet.

maml:description.maml:para: List out all mailboxes in Exchange Online for easy export to a report file.

List out all active mailboxes or filter by shared, resource or user mailboxes. Optionally include mailbox size. By default, outputs mailbox identity, displayname, email addresses (aliases), primary email address, type, address list hidden policy, recipeints with send on behalf permisson and forwarding details. Additional properties can be specified.
Specify one or more additional mailbox properties to display.
This will list all active, non-archive mailboxes.
This will retrieve the current mailbox total size.
Use this to only return resource mailboxes
Use this to only retun shared mailboxes
Use this to only return user mailboxes.
Specify one or more additional mailbox properties to display.
This will list all active, non-archive mailboxes.
This will retrieve the current mailbox total size.
Use this to only return resource mailboxes
Use this to only retun shared mailboxes
Use this to only return user mailboxes.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365MailboxReport -UserOnly -IncludeMailboxSize -AddProperties MaxSendSize | Export-Excel -Path C:\reports\M365MasterReport -WorksheetName MailboxReport -tablename MailboxReport -Autosize

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all user mailboxes, including mailbox size and maximum outgoing message size. Export to an excel workbook.

maml:description.maml:para: Return all groups a user is a member of
Returns every group a user object is a member of
Specify the AzureAD user object GUID or the UserPrincipalName of the user object.
Specify the AzureAD user object GUID or the UserPrincipalName of the user object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return a list of all groups user djust@davidjust.com is a member of.

maml:description.maml:para: Return a summary list of all SharePoint sites.

A simple wrapper function around 'Get-SPOSite'. This will handle connecting to SharePoint online and return a list of all SharePoint sites, including Title, Url, StorageQuota, StorageUsageCurrent, Owner, SharingCapability.
Include OneDrive sites in summary report.
Include OneDrive sites in summary report.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return a summary list of all SharePoint sites (excluding OneDrive sites)

maml:description.maml:para: List all enterprise applications with SSO integration.

List out all enterprise applications (service principals) in AzureAD with SAML SSO integration by utilizng the Microsoft Graph PowerShell SDK. Also list SAML signing certitifcate expiration date and notification email address(s).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365SSOEnterpriseApps | Export-Excel -Path C:\Reports\M365MasterReport.xlsx -Worksheetname SSOApps -TableName SSOApps -Autosize

dev:remarks.maml:para: List out all all enterprise applications in AzureAD with SAML SSO integration. Export to an Excel workbook by piping to Export-Excel.

maml:description.maml:para: List out all teams channels for every team.
List out every team channel and their associated members.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365TeamsChannelReport | Export-Excel -path C:\Reports\MasterReport.xlsx -Worksheetname TeamsChannelReport -Tablename TeamsChannels -Autosize

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a report for every teams channel and export to an excel workbook by piping to Export-Excel
Get a report for every teams channel and export to a CSV file by piping to Export-CSV. Exclude .NET type information.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a report listing every Microsoft Team
Returns a report listing every Microsoft Team, including name, description, visibility and members.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365TeamsReport | Export-Excel -path C:\Reports\MasterReport.xlsx -Worksheetname TeamsReport -Tablename Teams

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a report for every Microsoft Team and export to an excel workbook by piping to Export-Excel.
Get a report for every Microsoft Team and export to a CSV file by piping to Export-CSV. Exclude .NET type information.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a summary of all licenses in a tenant.
Return a table of all licenses including total count, assigned count, Sku name and friendly name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return a summary of all licenses in a Office 365 tenant.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the contents of any O365 Admin Center usage report.
{{ Fill in the Description }}
Period in days for the report to include.
Specify the report to retrieve.
Period in days for the report to include.
Specify the report to retrieve.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the Office365 Active User Detail report for the past 90 day period.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365UsageReport -ReportArea SharePointActivityUserDetail -Period D30 | Export-CSV -NoTypeInformation .\SPUserActivity.csv

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve the SharePoint User Activity detail report for the past 30 days and export to a CSV file.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of every user and their assigned licenses
This report with generate a list of every user and each license assigned to that user for easy export.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365UserLicenseReport | Export-Excel -path C:\Reports\MasterReport.xlsx -Worksheetname UserLicenseReport -Tablename UserLicenses

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export the user licese report to the excel workbook MasterReport.xlsx by piping to Export-Excel

maml:description.maml:para: Get a summary report for all user accounts in an M365 tenant.

Get a report of all user accounts, including guest accounts. By default, returns the following properties: UserPrincipalName id AccountEnabled Mail JobTitle PasswordPolicies UserType CreatedDateTime OnPremisesSyncEnabled MobilePhone BusinessPhone OfficeLocation UsageLocation StreetAddress City
Add addtional properties to report with -AddProperties.
Specify additional properties to add to output.
Gets only the specified number of objects. Enter the number of objects to get.

Reports the total number of objects in the data set (an integer) followed by the selected objects. If the cmdlet cannot determine the total count, it displays "Unknown total count." The integer has an Accuracy property that indicates the reliability of the total count value. The value of Accuracy ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 where 0.0 means that the cmdlet could not count the objects, 1.0 means that the count is exact, and a value between 0.0 and 1.0 indicates an increasingly reliable estimate.
Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.
Specify additional properties to add to output.
Gets only the specified number of objects. Enter the number of objects to get.

Reports the total number of objects in the data set (an integer) followed by the selected objects. If the cmdlet cannot determine the total count, it displays "Unknown total count." The integer has an Accuracy property that indicates the reliability of the total count value. The value of Accuracy ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 where 0.0 means that the cmdlet could not count the objects, 1.0 means that the count is exact, and a value between 0.0 and 1.0 indicates an increasingly reliable estimate.
Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-M365UserReport | Export-Excel -path C:\Reports\MasterReport.xlsx -Worksheetname UserReport -Tablename UserReport

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export the user report to the excel workbook 'MasterReport.xlsx' on worksheet name 'UserReport'.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the admin report settings to show names or conceal for privacy
Set the admin report settings to show names or conceal for privacy. The default value is to conceal names, however you will likely need to show names for your reports.
Specifying this parameter will conceal names in admin reports.
Specifying this parameter will show names in admin reports.
Specifying this parameter will conceal names in admin reports.
Specifying this parameter will show names in admin reports.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the admin report settings to show names in any admin reports.
Update the admin report settings to conceal names in any admin reports.
